name: Idyia
desc: An event-exclusive NPC. She is an Oceanid and the caretaker of the "Bottleland," Veluriyam Mirage.

imgDesc.text: Story cutscene in Act 3 of Secret Summer Paradise Event Quest.

Story cutscene in Act 3 of Secret Summer Paradise Event Quest.
"I am an Oceanid who was exiled here when the former Hydro Archon passed away. My name is Idyia."

customize.text: Idyia

<color=#ffffffd9>A theatrical performance based on Idyia's story:</color>
The girl hailed from a kingdom that sat atop the waterfalls. but when the reigning dynasty fell and a new one seized power, she and her people fled for their lives. A thick fog began to fill the air as she made her way through the forest, and dense thickets tried to block her path.
<color=#ffffffd9>"If only I had a lamp to guide me through this wretched forest… then I could survive…"</color>
With scratches covering her arms and legs, the girl pressed through the pain and made her way forward. The road ahead was arduous, but she was determined to press onward.
<color=#ffffffd9>"I've come this far, and I’m not about to turn back now."</color>
But just as she was drawing near her destination, a huge stretch of thorns and brambles suddenly came into view. Despair set in and began to weigh on her heart.
<color=#ffffffd9>"If only someone could help me… I would give anything in return."</color>

The girl's heartfelt wish in her moment of desperation did not go unheard… Her path was cleared, and so the girl continued her journey deeper into the forest. But what she found there was not a lamp, but a mage glowing with fire, who helped burn a path through the thicket. The mage took pity on the girl and handed her a bottle. Then, the mage began to tell the story of how the bottle came into her possession.
The fiery mage had an adventurous spirit and enjoyed taking long journeys. On one such journey, while taking a rest in an oasis, she found a beautiful bottle by a crescent-shaped lake. She was an extraordinary mage with the power to grant people their wishes. She turned the bottle into a thing of equally extraordinary power. But the only place that it could make wishes come true was inside of the bottle. The fiery mage blew into the bottle, allowing it to grant one single wish outside its glass walls. A flame was kindled within the bottle, and it began to glow a fiery red, just like the mage herself.
After the mage finished telling her story, she disappeared, leaving only the bottle behind.
<color=#ffffffd9>"A magic bottle that can grant wishes… Then, I wish to leave this place, and go somewhere where no one will ever find me again…"</color>

The flame in the bottle faded as the girl's single wish was granted, and she found herself in the middle of the desert, far away, where no one could ever find her.
Idyia is an Oceanid, who was exiled when the former Hydro Archon passed away and waters became full of pain and hatred. She was wandering through the forest when she met Alice, a witch from the Hexenzierkel. It was Alice who gave Idyia a magic bottle, which can grant one wish inside the bottle itself. Idiya wished to go far away, where no one could find her, so she ended up in the middle of the desert.

She continued to live in the subspace, called the Veluriyam Mirage, inside the bottle. Rare wanderers, who were passing by, came to her abode, asking to grant their wishes. When they had to leave, some were angry that the wish was granted only inside the Veluriyam Mirage, but some left Idyia gifts, which she

used for her adobe. Some wished to leave their mark on the Veluriyam Mirage, so Idyia made their copies with the help of Hydro eidolons, so she wouldn't be lonely. All eidolons represented the embodiment of the owners' desires.
Idyia is believed to be as powerful as Rhodeia, as she can not only take the human form, but also create Oceanid-humans from Eidolons.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Oceanids
customize.desc: Oceanids are intelligent Hydro lifeforms created by the previous Hydro Archon, Egeria, and are able to manipulate water at will. All the people of Fontaine were once Oceanids, whom Egeria had turned into humans to satisfy their wishes, going against the will of the Heavenly Principles.

customize.name: Alice
customize.desc: The Sustainer of the World's Borders, Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

customize.name: Egeria
customize.desc: The previous Hydro Archon who died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.name: Rhodeia
customize.desc: The most renowned and strongest of Lochfolk scouts. She fled Fontaine after the death of the previous Hydro Archon and settled in Qingce Village.

customize.text: Veluriyam Mirage

One summer, Klee received a letter from her mother Alice, in which she invited Klee to visit a friend in Sumeru. Klee asked the Traveler, Paimon, and Kaeya to go with her. In Sumeru, they searched for someone who had knowledge of the area and met Collei and Eula, who was searching for her relative.

Together they used the magic letter and were transported to the Veluriyam Mirage — a magical subspace created inside the bottle. There they met Alice's friend Idyia, who was the manager of Veluriyam Mirage, and Kokomi, the Divine Priestess of Watatsumi Island, who arrived at the Veluriyam Mirage on personal business.

It turned out that shortly before they arrived in the Veluriyam Mirage, the main core of subspace had broken, so they volunteered to help Idyia fix it. While the Traveler was looking for the necessary parts of the core, they met other visitors to the Veluriyam Mirage, who all had blue hair and eyes, and Hydro Eidolons — Hydro creatures that resemble water droplets. When all the lost core pieces were finally collected, it was revealed that Idyia was an Oceanid, who settled in the Veluriyam Mirage and helped travelers who found themselves in the desert.

All the people of Fontaine were once Oceanids, whom Egeria had turned into humans to satisfy their wishes, going against the will of the Heavenly Principles.

customize.name: Alice
customize.desc: The Sustainer of the World's Borders, Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

customize.name: Klee
customize.desc: An explosives expert and a regular at the Knights of Favonius's confinement room. Also known as Fleeing Sunlight.

customize.name: Eula
customize.desc: The Spindrift Knight, a scion of the old aristocracy, and the Captain of the Knights of Favonius Reconnaissance Company. The reason for which a descendant of the ancient nobles might join the Knights remains a great mystery in Mondstadt to this very day.

customize.name: Sangonomiya Kokomi
customize.desc: The Divine Priestess of Watatsumi Island. All of the island's affairs are at this young lady's fingertips.

customize.name: Kaeya
customize.desc: An accomplished swordsman and a strategic thinker in the Knights of Favonius, rumored to hail from beyond Mondstadt.

customize.name: Collei
customize.desc: A trainee ranger active in Avidya Forest. Behind her enthusiastic words and actions hides a slightly introverted personality.

customize.name: Travel Lamp
customize.desc: A lamp that the boy often used when studying at night. The flame can be adjusted via a mechanism in the lamp, and this was perhaps quite magical to a child who had never seen such a lamp before. Every time he saw the light from this lamp, he will think of the old days when he played various hand shadow characters and animals. This lamp was left here as a gift. Maybe this is a way for him to let go of his burden and move on.

customize.name: Familiar-Looking Candy Box
customize.desc: A candy box that is often used in various celebrations in Sumeru. When the girl who would become a researcher was still young, she used to take one candy a day from the box. Back in those days, her biggest worry was that the candy would run out. After becoming a researcher, this empty candy box has become a nostalgic reminder of other possibilities in life. This candy box was left here as a gift. To the researcher, this is also a symbol of freedom from misery.

customize.name: Mountaineering Rope
customize.desc: Mountaineering rope favored by adventurers. It's a bit old but well-maintained, so it can still be used as per normal. This rope was left here as a gift. Perhaps it is not just ropes that a person relies on when scaling great heights, but friendly hands that reach out to you.

customize.text: Illustrations and Emojis
Paimon's Paintings XXV

<color=#ffd780>July 17, 2023</color>
Greetings, Travelers! The latest emojis from Genshin Impact are now available on HoYoLAB~
Paimon's Paintings include a collection of chibi emojis of various Genshin Impact characters. We hope you like them! Paimon will continue to paint more cute emojis for everyone~

customize.name: Alice
customize.desc: The Sustainer of the World's Borders, Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

customize.text: The witch and Idyia's friend.

customize.name: Oceanid
customize.desc:
A life-form created from condensed Hydro elements of incredible purity. Often attached to bodies of water.
It is said that as water bodies become purer, the Hydro elements within grow more abundant, causing the Oceanids to grow more powerful. It is also said by some that Oceanids were once sea creatures from a home far away who carried the fragments of a long-dead god to the many corners of this world. Perhaps they did this so that the love their god held for this world could be spread through the waters to all the land...

customize.name: Endora
customize.desc: Just a very curious Lochfolk who only wishes to see the world. Might actually get along very well with Mini Seelie: Dayflower, but please do not meld them together, thank you.

customize.name: Callirhoe
customize.desc: Callirhoe, also known as Spring Fairy, is an Oceanid who left Fontaine after the previous Archon's death and settled in Springvale.

customize.name: Lyris
customize.desc: The Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage in Fontaine, she later became a member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and gained the title of "Red Empress" after the Institute was abandoned during the Cataclysm.

customize.text: Oceanids.

customize.name: Klee
customize.desc: An explosives expert and a regular at the Knights of Favonius's confinement room. Also known as Fleeing Sunlight.

customize.text: Alice's daughter, who refers to Idyia as Aunty Desert. Alice invited Klee to stay with Idyia in Bottleland for the Summer.
Related Items

customize.name: "Returning Curios" Memento (I)
customize.desc: A memento discovered at a treasure site in the Veluriyam Mirage event, "Returning Curios." The treasure chest that contains it corresponds to the first code — "A sweet mist permeates all, gazing toward the dancing lamplight, I almost forget to breathe. In the end, memories of childhood guide me, and I take my seat beside the table in peace..."

customize.name: "Returning Curios" Memento (II)
customize.desc: A memento discovered at a treasure site in the Veluriyam Mirage event, "Returning Curios." The treasure chest that contains it corresponds to the second code — "A shooting star of vines carries me, traversing a forest so quiet and peaceful, to finally arrive in secluded dreamland so pure."

customize.name: "Returning Curios" Memento (III)
customize.desc: A memento discovered at a treasure site in the Veluriyam Mirage event, "Returning Curios." The treasure chest that contains it corresponds to the third code — "A blue, spotless ceiling, a floor of white candy, soft companions surround me, I too have wings!"

customize.name: Mysterious Mora Pocketwatch
customize.desc:
A Mora-shaped (and Mora-shiny) pocketwatch you accidentally found in the Veluriyam Mirage. This one bears a strong resemblance to a Mora pocketwatch left behind by a seasoned adventurer in the earliest days of "Returning Curios." One wonders how much it is worth.
However, Idyia also says that "it's not about the value of the treasure or the watch, but the stories hidden inside the treasures!" Perhaps using monetary value as the measure of this memento is not the most fitting...
